item.title: Bashrc customizations
item.description: Bash Prompt PS1=$'\[\e[0;1;38;5;111m\]\w \[\e[$(($?==0?92:91))m\]\u279c \[\e[0m\]'; PROMPT_DIRTRIM=2 or without supported nerd fonts: PS1=$'\[\e[0;1;38;5;111m\]\w \[\e[$(($?==0?92:91))m\]$ \[\e[0m\]'; PROMPT_DIRTRIM=2 Directory from home uses a if-else ternary expression $(($?==0?92:91)) that makes the color code 0;91m (red, see color codes) if the last command exits with non-zero, or 0;92m green otherwise. $ prompt PROMPT_DIRTRIM=2 shows the current and the parent directory, collapsing the rest of the hierarchy.
